title: Contingency Model-based Control (CMC) for Communicationless Cooperative Collision Avoidance in Robot Swarms
summary: Cooperative collision avoidance between robots, or `agents,' in swarm operations remains an open challenge. Assuming a decentralized architecture, each agent is responsible for making its own decisions and choosing its control actions. Most existing approaches rely on a (wireless) communication network between (some of) the agents. In reality, however, communication is brittle.
